info.title: Virtual disk cache modes: Basic concept

section.title: What is a disk cache?
section.para: A disk cache is a memory that is used to speed up the process of storing and accessing data from the hard disk. Physical hard disks have their cache integrated as a standard feature. For virtual disks, the cache uses &vmhost;'s memory and you can fine-tune its behavior, for example, by setting its type.

section.title: How does a disk cache work?
section.para: Typically, a disk cache stores the most recent and frequently used programs and data. When a user or program requests data, the operating system first reviews the disk cache. If the data is found, the operating system quickly delivers the data from the memory to the program instead of re-reading it from the disk.
